subject: Education
title: Feed-Up, Feed-Back, Feed-Forward
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Feed-Up, Feed-Back, Feed-Forward.

hook.text: Good feedback answers three questions: Where am I going? How am I doing? What comes next?

buildup.text: John Hattie's framework splits feedback into feed-up (the goal), feed-back (progress), feed-forward (next steps).

discovery.text: Most teachers provide feed-back but skip feed-up and feed-forwardâ€”students know their score but not what to do.

twist.text: Feed-forwardâ€”'here's what to try next time'â€”produces the largest learning gains.

climax.text: Students who receive all three types of feedback improve twice as fast.

punchline.text: Knowing where you are isn't useful if you don't know where to go.

quiz.question: Which component of Hattie's feedback framework produces the largest learning gains?
